UML:TaggedValue.value: Description All communication involving sensitive information outside the trusted zones must be integrity and confidentiality protected according to security requirements Measure to check Communication channels outside the trusted zones are encrypted. Rationale Sensitive information is protected against security threats. Reference MPOWER R1.2.1 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 4

Description Provide a control mechanism for module-to-module messaging, especially to hanlde the problem of partly trusted modules. Measure to check Untrusted modules do not receive restricted information from trusted modules. Rationale Modules which are trusted may not provide restricted information to modules which are not trusted. Reference PERSONA R2.2.17.4 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 3

Description It has to be assured by the architecture that access of authorized persons or subsystems cannot be invalidated by unauthorized persons or subsystems (i.e., denial-of-service). Measure to check Authorized persons/subsystems can always access the system even when unauthorized persons/subsystems try to avoid this. Rationale Denial-of-service may entail economic damages and significant reduction of user-value. Reference GENESYS R2.2.13.1 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 2,5

Description System should be able to detect unauthorized manipulation of data that is being transmitted. Measure to check Data protection mechanism are implemented in the communication processess. Rationale The system should be protected against any type of thread concerning security and data protection Reference MPOWER R2.2.17.8 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 4

Description Data freshness may be controlled to prevent changes of replay attacks. Measure to check Replay attacks are detected and blocked Rationale The system should be protected against any type of thread concerning security and data protection. Reference MPOWER R2.2.14.9 WP: 4 Ranking: 2

Description System should support integrity protection of sensitive personal data while it is stored. Measure to check Data integrity mechanisms are implemented. Rationale Private data is protected from beeing accessed by unauthorized persons or systems. Reference MPOWER R2.2.17.7 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 4

Description The architecture has to be able do determine the real identity of systems or users. Measure to check The identity of each user in the system is truly known. Rationale In order to authorize the access to the system, authentication has to be assured. Reference GENESYS R2.2.17.1 MPOWER R2.2.17.3 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 5

Description System should be able to log security incidents, such as failed login attempts or unauthorised access attempts to services in order to discover and trace system abuse. Measure to check Security incidents are logged. Rationale The system should be protected against any type of thread concerning security and data protection Reference MPOWER R2.2.17.9 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 5

Description System shall enable secure data exchange between any customer registered in the system Measure to check Data protection mechanism (e.g. ciphering protocols) are implemented in the communication processess Rationale The customer does not want to have its private data being accessed by anyone when transmitted Reference MPOWER R2.2.12.3, R2.2.17.1, R2.2.17.2, R2.2.17.6 PERSONA R2.2.17.2 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 5

Description Ambient intelligent (AmI) environments formed as open distributed systems must be made trustable by providing for node & module authorization Measure to check Nodes and modules are authorized separately. Rationale Nodes and modules are identified individually, so a malicious module running on an authorized node cannot pretend to be another module. Reference PERSONA R2.2.17.3 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 3,5

Description Mechanisms for irrefutable proof of who initiated an actions within a system, have to be provided by the architecture. Measure to check For each action within the system it is known who initiated this action. Rationale Non-repudiability is the basis for accountability and liability. Reference GENESYS R2.2.17.3 MPOWER R2.2.14.10 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 4

Description Differentiate between identifiable entities (e.g., users, modules) that can be authenticated (necessitates the management of their identities and credentials) and anonymous entities that can not be authenticated while not excluding the second group blindly Measure to check An anonymous user is available. Rationale Different data or services may be accessible by anyone without authentification. Reference PERSONA R2.2.17.1 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 4

Description Trusted zones must be established for the system componets that are processing and storing sensitive data. Measure to check The existence of trusted zones. Rationale A trusted site is typically a controlled area where servers and communcication lines are protected from unauthorised external access. These areas should be physically access protected. Reference MPOWER R1.2.1 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 4

Description Access to the system may only be granted to users and systems that have the appropriate permission. Measure to check Access to services is not granted to users or systems without permission. Rationale A service can only be accessed by legitimate users or systems. Reference GENESYS R2.2.17.2 MPOWER R2.2.17.3, R2.2.17.4, R2.2.17.5 PERSONA R2.2.17.1 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 5

Description System shall allow data validation at time of data reception to reduce threats represented by malicious content. Measure to check No malicious content is introduced into the system Rationale The system should be protected against any type of thread concerning security and data protection. Reference MPOWER R2.2.14.7 WP: 4 Ranking: 2
